intro: Calyptranthes urbanii, commonly known as the urbanii calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Due to its ornamental value and unique botanical features, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
